Since the money Alice gains is now worth 19% less than in the first round, we need to calculate its current value to her. 19% of $5800 is $1102, so the value to her is $5800 - $1102 = $4698 in terms of the original value.

Considering the inflation, Alice's $5800 is actually worth $4698 in original value, while my $4200 remains the same. This means the real split, considering the value to both parties, is closer to 55-45 in my favor when adjusted for inflation.
